fields.description:
Raised this improvement on behalf of customer

{quote}During a bulk move operation, I discovered that it is only possible to bulk move issues if I set the inactive accounts as active, otherwise either the assignee or reporter fields are prompted for.

I suspect this behavior is arising from the fact that a 'move' requires a 'create' to occur in the destination project, which in turn requires all users to be active, since it is not permitted to manually edit an issue's assignee or reporter to an inactive user.

However, in this particular use-case, it would be very desirable to be able to preserve the reporter and assignee even if the user account is inactive.
{quote}

The ideal solution would be to permit a move operation to retain inactive users as either assignees or reporters.

h4. Workaround
# Temporarily activate the user
# Perform the bulk operation
# Deactivate the user

This would help retain the history of the issue correctly.
fields.summary: Permit move operation to retain inactive user as assignee/reporter of the issue

Currently, the only way to see what a filter looks for in issues is to click on it (and switch to Advanced) to see its JQL description.
This is quite ennoying when you just need to compare filters, or even check what it is meant for.
Especially when filters return a large number of issues, this obliges the search.

Therefore it would be usefull to show the filter JQL description in the "Manage Filters" screen.
So there would be columns like:

||Name||JQL description||Owner||Shared with||Subscriptions||
|Filter1|issue in project1|J.Doe|Private|None|
|Filter2|issue in project2 and status=Open|J.Doe|Private|None|

...

fields.description:
tl;dr The screenshot says it all. The 10th July 2013 is a Wednesday.

It seems there has been some hacking done to use the Browser's time zone to display dates on the JIRA UI. This is a BUG.  The doumentation clearly states:
{quote}
you can personalise your JIRA account to use a time zone of your choice. This will affect all time-date fields throughout JIRA.
{quote}

If this is a required feature, that is using the Browser timezone then a number of things need to be addressed:
* Must be consistent across all the UI.
* There must be a preference in the Edit User Profile dialog to allow the options: Use System Default, Use Browser Timezone or I'll set my Timezone
* This must be applied to all the backgound things as well, eg. JQL searches, Subscriptions, Version Overdue calculations etc.
* The documentation must be updated.
* The default behaviour for new users must be configurable.
* The default behaviour for anonymous users must be configurable.
* On upgrade the current behaviour should not change for existing customers.
* What the default is for new BTF and new OD customers must be considered and documented.
fields.summary: Client-side rendered timestamps do not respect timezone in user preference

I would like to be able to send an email back to a user after issue collector submission.  Since the collector already tracks who is logged in and user profiles contain email addresses most of the data needed is already in the system.  I realize this would not work for non-account holders.  The hard part would be creating a place in the collector UI where you could use HTML to customize your reply email for each collector.

This is auto-reply feature has also been requested for JIRA in the following tickets. I'm just extending the idea a bit.
* JRA-12650
* JRA-21959

Thanks for the consideration. You are all doing great work!
fields.summary: Enable auto-response from issue collector-based issue creation

*Another way to reproduce this*
# Create a project or open a project you don't need anymore
# Go to project settings->delete project

*Expect:*
after project got deleted, maybe the button should be changed to create project?

*Actual*
on the top left corner, the button name changes to variable string "back to $project.name". Click the button take me back to delete project screen again.


Steps to reproduce:
  - Log into a JIRA project as an administrator of said project.
  - Add yourself to the "Administrators" field
  - Change the Project Lead to somebody else.
  - Save through the form.

*Expected Result:*
  I'm not entirely positive what the expected result should be, but i get a rejection that says i cannot change the lead.

*Actual Result:*
  I receive an error message, with a button that shows "Back to project: $project.name" 

If I click on said button, i receive a message that says "No project could be found with key '$\{project.key}'"

*Reproducible:*
Yes

*Notes:*
I go back to the administration panel, and it says I do not have administration access to any projects.  The Project Lead was also successfully changed.

fields.description:
Basically, the the issue created date does not match the time-zone configured in the user profile settings. However, when you mouse-over the issue created date it will shows the correct time-zone that the user has set earlier on his user profile.

h3. Unexpected Behaviour:
!1.jpg!
The above screenshot shows that the issue is created on *22/Jul/13 4:38 PM* in *GMT+8* time-zone which is *not correct* however when you *mouse-over* the date, it will show the correct time-zone date which is *22/Jul/13 3:38 PM* in *GMT+7* (which is *correct* according to the user profile settings which is set on *GMT+7*)

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. View any existing issue in JIRA
2. Notice the *issue created date*
3. Go to *User Profile* and change the time-zone to a different value compare to the original default time-zone
4. You will notice that the *issue created date* still remains the same as is showing the original default time-zone. However when you *mouse-over* it, it will show the correct time-zone value.

(i) *Side Note:* I have personally tested this on *JIRA 5.2.11*, it works absolutely fine.
fields.summary: Issue created date does match with the time-zone configured user profile setting in JIRA 6

fields.description:
Our plugin uses webResources, but the only way so far to include them into the new screen available in the issue navigator (http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/05/meet-new-jira-6/ , "Detail View: optimize the way you work with issues") is to add them into atl.general context: {code}
<web-resource key="foo" name="FooBar">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:jquery</dependency>
        <context>atl.general</context>
        <context>atl.admin</context>
 
        <resource type="download" name="baz.js" location="js/baz.js">
            <property key="content-type" value="text/javascript"/>
        </resource>
</web-resource>
{code}
if I use {code}
webResourceManager.requireResource("com.qux.jira:foo")
{code} (in the vm template)
the web-resources are not included.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# create a customfield plugin module
# put in atlassian-plugin.xml: {code}
<web-resource key="foo" name="FooBar"> 
        <resource type="download" name="baz.js" location="js/baz.js">
            <property key="content-type" value="text/javascript"/>
        </resource>
        <resource type="download" name="baz2.js" location="js/baz2.js">
            <property key="content-type" value="text/javascript"/>
        </resource>
</web-resource>
{code}
# put into the vm template (customfield view vm): {code}
$!webResourceManager.requireResource("com.qux.jira:foo")
{code}
# navigate to BASE_URL/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show&createNew=true
# set the view for the IssueNavigator to "Detail View"
# refresh the page (ctrl+F5)
# check that the resource is not included to the page (put alert to the loaded .js, or load a css, and check that it is applied)
(!) see, that the resource is not loaded
fields.summary: webResourceManager.requireResource does not work for JIRA 6 issue navigator 'detail view'

Hi Guys 

Need help with the JSON to update field type (either one) 
Check Box 
Radio Button 
Select List 

I had been following the instructions from: https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+Example+-+Create+Issue#JIRARESTAPIExample-CreateIssue-MultiSelect  

Everything worked except the updates to the above field types. 

Here are 3 custom field: 
Multi Checkboxes  :  customfield_19701 
Radio Buttons        :  customfield_19702 
Select List              :  customfield_19703 

Issue the follow JSON through REST API. All the other fields I need updating (Number, Date, Text) worked except for the above field types. 

{"update":{"customfield_19703":{"value":"Y"}}} 

What is wrong with this update command? This is because the REST API keeps getting 400 response. 
Can you please let me know what I should be issuing to get this JSON updating the field correctly. 

THanks
fields.summary: Jira REST API - Need Help to Update Check Box / RadioButton / Select List JSON format incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34112].
  {panel}

# Clear instance create projects ONE and TWO from Issue Tracking project template
# Create one bug in either ONE or TWO project.
# Select all issues (1) in issue nav
# Bulk change all 1 issues, move issues
# Select the other project with a mouse, press next.
# (result) error on page.

What I found so far: 
* Creating projects from common template causes them to have the same issue types, Issue Tracking template is not essential
* If you would expand issue types available in the target project after choosing it you would get an empty list. However, for some reason, clicking next after expanding possible issue types does not cause the error message.
* Func Tests do not assert on that, since they use the underlying <select/> to perform changes, which is the essence of the bug - the options are not in there.
* Manifests on Master, does not manifest on JDOG...
fields.summary: Bulk move does not properly retrieve target context issue types

fields.summary: whereismycf REST resource throws exception

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34110].
  {panel}

Currently, the test resources that are used in AMPS JIRA plugin contain no projects, and only one "admin" user.

This is unlikely an ideal initial set up for most plugin developers.

I would propose to make the following changes to the test resources:
* add a new 'sysadmin' user that has system administrator permission
* change the current 'admin' user to have only administrator permission (revoke the system administrator permission)
* add a new non-admin user 'joe' or 'fred'.

Ideally the changes mentioned above are the same across all product's test resources to make it easier to write tests for cross-product plugin.

Additionally, we should also make the following changes specifically for JIRA:
* add a new project "TEST"
* add a couple of issues to the "TEST" project, ideally in various state, and with comments.
fields.summary: Generate more test data in test resources

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34109].
  {panel}

* 830 projects
* 284 issue types
* 1828 custom fields! (many with different project contexts)

Now when we associate an issue type scheme with a project the following code is where all the time is taken up:
{noformat}
"http-8080-6@12301" daemon prio=5 tid=0x51 nid=NA runnable
  java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	  at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$HashIterator.advanceTo(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:4050)
	  at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$HashIterator.nextInChain(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:4021)
	  at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$HashIterator.advance(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:3995)
	  at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:4072)
	  at com.google.common.cache.CustomConcurrentHashMap$KeyIterator.next(CustomConcurrentHashMap.java:4087)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.invalidateMatchingKeys(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:201)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.store(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:157)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.setValue(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:83)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.storeAssociateContexts(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:327)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.updateFieldConfigScheme(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:232)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.pro.AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.run(AssociateIssueTypeSchemes.java:135)
	  at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.MigrateIssueTypes.doPerform(MigrateIssueTypes.java:164)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:-1)
	  at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	  at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{noformat}

Essentially in at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.storeAssociateContexts(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:327) we have 613 contexts.  For each context we then get into a loop in  com.atlassian.jira.issue.context.persistence.CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.invalidateMatchingKeys(CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.java:201) where we have a cache that contains 413467 entries.

So in total we end up iterating 613 * 413467 = 253455271 times. That's a lot :).  As far as I can tell that's simply done to invalidate cache entries in the CachingFieldConfigContextPersister.  This is where I ran out of time to investigate further but given the customer data and information above should be enough for someone on bugfix to reproduce.  There's probably more efficient ways we could be clearing cache entries (using map.remove(key) rather than iterating with a predicate perhaps).
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme association takes an excessive amount of time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34108].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

Create 2 projects
Add a custom field to only one of the 2 project
Go to the simple searcher and try and add the custom field to the search.

This will fail.

If you select the project to which the custom field is associated, then the search will work.

Expected:

You should be able to provide nothing other than the search field you want to use. This is the same as using JQL to write customfield = abc. There is no need to specify a project or issue type.
fields.summary: Project and Issue Type should not be required to search Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Add new status in JIRA
2. Create transition to new status with a screen associated to it
3. Associate workflow with 'project A'
4. Go to Issue Navigator. Search results should include issues from 'project A' and issue from a different project where the workflow transition(id) created in step 2 is not present.
5. Perform the newly created transition on an issue while viewed in the Issue Navigator
6. Select an issue from different project(see note about search results in step 4)
6. Choose the 'Assign' option
7. Attempt to search for an assignee

- assigning the issue as usual

fields.description:
Importing OnDemand backup to JIRA behind the firewall ran into the following error:

{noformat}
2013-07-30 20:21:33,760 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1221x174x1 jmwgs9 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: PluginState
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: PluginState
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.makeValue(GenericDelegator.java:430)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.makeValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:385)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.OfbizImportHandler.startElement(OfbizImportHandler.java:205)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.parseXmlAndValidateBackupData(DefaultDataImportService.java:321)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:249)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:146)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:439)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:895)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:918)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)
{noformat}

Suspected to be caused by there is new entity introduced on the on demand version which is yet to be available on the JIRA Self Hosted.

Tested using latest On Demand backup (as of current release: 30th July 2013) restoring to JIRA 6.0.5 according to the version matrix:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+JIRA+OnDemand+to+a+JIRA+Installed+Site

*Workaround*
# Extract the entities.xml from the backup's zip
# Open the entities.xml and remove all PluginState tags.
#* Alternatively on Linux/Unix based machine, run the following command in the same folder where the entities.xml is located:
{code}
egrep -v "PluginState" entities.xml > entities-clean.xml
{code}
# Rename the entities-clean.xml to entities.xml and zip together again with the activeobject.xml (Remember to move the previous entities.xml to another location before rename so no naming conflict)
# Perform the restore again
# Acknowledge the error of the index path and attachment path
# Restore Complete

fields.description:
The absence of the [Browse Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Managing+Global+Permissions] *Global Permission* causes the *WAS* parameter to throw an error when it is used in the Advanced Search.

_Steps to Reproduce_
* Ensure that the *Browse Users* permission is set to at least a user / group. In this case, we just set it to *Anyone*:
!advance_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Run the following query below and it displays the results on the *Issue Navigator* just fine:
!advance_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* After that, we removed the *Browse Users* Global Permission to no one:
!advance_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* The following error will be thrown on the UI when the same JQL is being run on the Advanced Search:
!advance_4.JPG|thumbnail!

Is there any explanation to why the *Browse Users* permission is mandatory when the *WAS* parameter needs to be used in JQL? What does the *error* mean?

(-) A value provided by the function 'currentUser' is invalid for the field 'assignee'.
fields.summary: JIRA "WAS" parameter Advanced Search breaks without the "Browse Users" Global Permission
document for JIRA explaining why we dont support hot standby

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34094].
  {panel}

e.g. we have Administrator and User role.
Administrator is subscribed to all-all jira notifications.
User is only subscribed to own jira notification.

User A with Administrator and User roles is added.

Is it possible to put a special header "X-Atlassian-Initiated-Reason:"? Or some other approach so this can be filtered by Gmail easily.

If email is received because user A has more privileged "Administrator" role then "X-Atlassian-Initiated-Reason: Administrator" header is put. If not then "X-Atlassian-Initiated-Reason: User" is put. This would allow to be administrator-related emails to be filtered from inbox and be accessed if something is needed. Also Gmail provides far more superior search so it's easier to find something in your mailbox instead of JIRA search.
fields.summary: Differentiate email notifications based on user privileges

fields.description:
On an issue, it's possible to edit fields that aren't visible by using the {{.}} (dot) menu. The dialog has a bug when a validation error occurs.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open an issue that contains a field that's not visible (because it has no value) *and* contains validation (e.g. a Date field)
# Press {{.}} and search for the field by name and open the edit field dialog.
# Type an invalid value and submit it.

A validation error will be returned, and the 'Submit' button will be disabled. At this point there is no way to re-enable the button. It also causes Date picker inputs to become broken.
fields.summary: Edit value custom field dialog breaks after a validation error.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34090].
  {panel}

The project having this issue contains a large number of Components, therefore typing filters component names makes selection simpler. When typing the entire name and changing focus though, an error appears. There are two distinct cases:

1. Displaying an Issue on the screen makes Component field editable (pen icon allows editing). When user begins to type, auto-complete is active, the "option" appears clearly. Entire option is edited; enter or ok issues the error (see ManualEditComponent.jpg image).

2. Creating a new Issue and editing Component field is somewhat similar, but only if focus is switched from the Component field after entirely typing to another field with mouse selection; then error appears; if focus to another field is done by pressing TAB, everything seems to work fine (see CreateIssueComponent.jpg image).


Thanks for resolving this,
Roxana

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34081].
  {panel}

Currently comments in the form of this {{key-01}} or {{\[key-01\]}} will be picked up by the renderer and it will check if they're an existing Issue. If it exists it will create a link to that issue.

However, it does not checked if the issue was ever moved, if an issue was moved it will not be picked up and the text will be shown as plain text. 

The {{moved_issue_key}} could be used to see if the link should be made. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create two JIRA projects
# Create one issue in each (ie. OG-1 and TR-1)
# Create a comment in TR-1 with the following text: {{OG-1}}
** This comment will link to OG-1
# move OG-1 to the other project
** OG-1 will now have the key TR-2
# Refresh the comments of TR-1

*Result*
The comment in TR-1 will now be plaintext instead of a link.
fields.summary: The wiki markup renderer should check for Moved Issues

fields.description:
After an attempt is made to upgrade a v4.4.4 version of a JIRA database to v6.0.5, the following error appears in the log: 2013-07-27 23:34:11,987 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Errors occurred during upgrade: 2013-07-27 23:34:11,988 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Upgrade Error: JIRA is unable to migrate the User Directory configuration because external password management is enabled but the osuser.xml file is not available.
Please see JIRA 4.3 User Management Changes for details. A number of issues: - The error message includes a link to JIRA v4.3 upgrade instructions, when the database being migrated is from v4.4. There is no obvious explanation for the error message. - The v4.4 installation contains no osuser.xml at all, and therefore the message is indeed correct, there is no and was no osuser.xml file. There are no hints or clues as to what action should be taken, this message is too vague to be useful. - There are some vague references that show up in Google to suggest that osuser.xml disappeared in v4.4.x and above, but no details or explanation. To fix this, please remove the weasel words from the error message, be concrete and specific as to what is wrong, and be concrete and precise as to what the long suffering administrator has to do to make this work.
fields.summary: Upgrade Error: JIRA is unable to migrate the User Directory configuration because external password management is enabled but the osuser.xml file is not available
In the issue's history it is difficult to identify what was actually changed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34064].
  {panel}

Basically, customer complaint that his user which is having eye sight problem will need to have a screen resolution of *800 x 600* in order to use JIRA. However, currently JIRA will required a minimum screen resolution of *1024 x 768* in order to fully utilize JIRA. 

h3. Customer Personal Feedback
{quote}
One thing to pass on to Atlassian is that the “What’s new” pop-up is not great for people using a low screen resolution. The trouble is the pop up can’t be scrolled and so the only option is to zoom out (meaning I can no longer read the information contained in the pop-up). Here is how it appears on my screen:
!Accessibility 01.png|thumbnail!
This is spread over two 800x600 resolution screens.

Secondly trying the menus I get:
!Accessibility 02.png|thumbnail!

It seems that it is being rendered ridiculously short with respect to the available screen height. Atlassian probably need to look at the routine used to assess this. Please do praise them for the ability to now use the scroll wheel on this menu again it is usable! Just tricky to get context form as many menu items as possible (even if you have to scroll for the final few).

I’ve not got much time at the moment for an extensive test but hope that these initial observations will be useful. I’d be grateful if you could let me know what happens about these things as it will make Jira more difficult to use.
{quote}
fields.summary: accessibility option for JIRA

When a user add many columns to be displayed in the sub-task, a weird behavior will appear whereby the arrow to rearrange sub-taks will not be visible when the user hover on the arrow. However, it will still be visible when the mouse pointer is not on the arrows. As the following screen-shots:
!rearrange.PNG|thumbnail!
!rearrange3.PNG|thumbnail!

h3.Steps to produce:
# Create a new issue, and create a sub-task for the issue
# Go to _Advanced Settings_ and add the property {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}} to have many columns to display in the sub-task. (in my case, I had 9 columns)
# Go back to the parent issue, and you can see the problem araise when you try to rearrange the sub-task.
fields.summary: Not able to rearrange the order of sub-tasks due to too many columns

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Setup a JNDI mail server according to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=42795030]
# Under SMTP Host section in the JIRA Outgoing Mail Server configuration, set the *Protocol* to *SECURE_SMTP* and save the configuration
# Send a test mail and the following message will thrown as JIRA can't connect to localhost:
{code}
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: localhost, port: 465;
  nested exception is:
	java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.sendWithMessageId(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:201)
	at com.atlassian.mail.server.impl.SMTPMailServerImpl.send(SMTPMailServerImpl.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.webwork.SendTestMail.doExecute(SendTestMail.java:107)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:83)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
{code}

h3. Expected Results:
Send test mail successful.

Actual Results:
The test mail can't send successfully, even though normal mail notifications work fine

h3. Workaround:
Set the Protocol to SMTP and send test mail will be succesful.

h3. Note:

The Protocol configuration has no impact on the mail functionality as notification still able to send out of JIRA as long as the JNDI configuration is correct.
fields.summary: JNDI mail configuration send test mail fail is misleading user

fields.description:
Note: all of the following assumes this specific corporate environment:

- the option "enable native XMLHTTP support" is unchecked and disabled by group policy on all IE browsers. 
- IE8 is the corporate standard and IE9/10 are not supported (users will be told to roll back).
- the user can and has successfully disabled "Compatibility View" on their browser.

Problem:  When using IE8 with JIRA 6.0.2, the user is _unable to create a new issue_.  Specifically this is because the multi-select fields "Affects Version", "Fix Version" and "Components" are rendered incorrectly [^JIRA IE8 Create Issue Stage 2.PNG].  They are also non-editable, ie. pressing TAB skips over these fields.  It's also worth noting that instead of displaying the dynamically loading Create Issue popup, an in-line Create Issue screen is displayed with two stages - first you select project and issue type, then click Next to load the full Create Issue page [^JIRA IE8 Create Issue Stage 1.PNG].

This problem is not evident on IE9 or IE10 with the same group policy, nor in Chrome or Firefox.

Why This Is A Regression:  This problem is not evident on JIRA 5.2 under the exact same environment.

Speculative Cause: The ActiveX fallback on IE8 which takes effect when native XMLHTTP is disabled does not appear to be working any more for IE8.  Note that it still works for the IE9 and IE10 browsers.

The following matrix indicates the regression:

| Browser | JIRA 5.2.10 | JIRA 6.0.2 |
| IE8 | OK | {color:red} NOT OK {color} |
| IE9 | OK | OK |
| IE10 | OK | OK |
| Chrome | OK | OK |
| Firefox | OK | OK |
fields.summary: Regression of ActiveX fallback in JIRA 6 for IE8 browsers
Associate a Saved filter with either list or detailed view by default

fields.description:
Using the smart query syntax for components ('c:component') doesn't work when the component contains an & (for example 'Knowledge Base & News').

In my instance, I search for {{c:knowledge}}.
The query resolves to {{project = TD AND component = "Knowledge Base "}}.
I expect the query to resolve to {{project = TD AND component = "Knowledge Base & News"}}.
fields.summary: Smart query breaks on c: for components containing a '&'

fields.description:
Currently activity streams do fill Jira logs with WARNIGNS like

{code}
2013-07-25 09:44:55,337 http-bio-8080-exec-38 WARN anonymous 584x3367388x2 - 1.2.3.4 /plugins/servlet/streams [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] User 'john.doeo' referenced by trusted application: 'jira:8750805' is not found.
{code}

It is perfectly normal not to have some users on some Jira instances and activity stream is not supposed to log these as WARNING and not even as INFO.

If there is any desire to log these, they should be DEBUG messages, not visible on the default log level.

Let me explain the severity of the case: we have two major instances, both connected to crowd. One is external, where people can create accounts and another ones is the internal once. 

For security we cannot allow these two instances to have the same user bases, even if we would not allow the external users to login. A simple security breach would be if you clone one bug from external to internal, the watchers will be cloned too and you will end-up with an external watcher on an internal ticket.... imagine the impact when these could be military customers.

Having a huge amount of noise in the jira log is very dangerous as it may hide real errors that needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: Remove log WARNINGS regarding missing users on activity streams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34044].
  {panel}

By providing a custom field that is able to pick not only users but also groups Jira accesibility could be simplified considerably.

This could even replace the two existing customfiels: users picker and groups picker.

If correctly implemented this could ease fixing of a long range of issues we do currently present: giving access to issues to list of people, group watchers. 

If groups could act as users this could solve other problems, like ability to assign issues to groups. Obviously a group does not have an email address, instead it has a list of email addreses of all its members.
fields.summary: Provide a native user or groups picker custom field

fields.description:
h3.Steps to produce:
# Go to _System > Issue Feature > Time Tracking_, and make sure that the *Legacy Mode* is set to _ON_
# Create an issue, and set the _Original Estimate_ to be 1h for example
# Log work more than the _Original Estimate_, for example 2h
# Delete the work that you have logged
# You will notice the _Remaining Estimate_ has changed to 2h
# Click on the *Edit* button on the issue screen, and  edit the _Original Estimate_ to be 2h
# Click *Update*

You will notice that the _Original Estimate_ is still set to 1h. However, if you try to edit the _Original Estimate_ to be more or less than the _Remaining Estimates_ it will work as expected.

h3.Workaround:
Currently, the only workaround is to deactivate the *Legacy Mode*.
fields.summary: Legacy Mode prevents from editing the Original Estimated to a value that equals the Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34038].
  {panel}

As far as I can tell, the only way to change a project lead is to say you want to edit the project roles.  Not only is this quite a detour, it also makes no sense because the project lead and default assignee are *not* project roles.

Let's start in a sensible place, the global project admin:

!ProjectLead_01_ProjectAdmin.png!

You can see it, but you can't edit it.  Well there's an Edit button, so maybe there...

!ProjectLead_02_EditProject.png!

Nope.  The field isn't there (and worse still, if there's something wrong with the current value, like the user was deleted by LDAP, then the edit dialog redisplays and the error isn't visible, since it is attached to a field that isn't there.  See JRA-33843, for example).  Well maybe if you view the project itself...

!ProjectLead_03_ProjectOverview.png!

Nope, still no way to edit it.  Well this is the overview, not the administration view, so maybe that's it....

!ProjectLead_04_Admin.png!

Nope.  I can see it in two places, and neither one lets me edit it.  To get to where I can change it I have to go into "Roles: View Project Roles" link, at which point I get:

!ProjectLead_05_ProjectRoles.png!

And can *finally* edit them.
fields.summary: Changing the project lead/default assignee is not in a sensible place
